intro: Stachyocnide luzonica, commonly known as the Luzon stachyocnide, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. It produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers, which are followed by small, red berries. Stachyocnide luzonica is often found in lowland and montane forests, thriving in humid, shaded environments.
